All the portlets are in social-portlet.war

h1. SpaceMenuPortlet
h2. Description
Display the menu on the right of a Space: Home, Dashboard, Members, SpaceSettings
h2. Portlet.xml

{code:xml}
 <portlet>
    <description xml:lang="EN">Space Menu Portlet</description>
    <portlet-name>SpaceMenuPortlet</portlet-name>
    <display-name xml:lang="EN">Space Menu</display-name>
    <portlet-class>org.exoplatform.webui.application.portlet.PortletApplicationController</portlet-class>
    <init-param>
      <name>webui.configuration</name>
      <value>/WEB-INF/conf/portlet/SpaceMenuPortlet/webui/configuration.xml</value>
    </init-param>
    <expiration-cache>0</expiration-cache>
    <supports>
      <mime-type>text/html</mime-type>
    </supports>
    <supported-locale>en</supported-locale>
    <resource-bundle>locale.portlet.SpaceMenuPortlet</resource-bundle>
    <portlet-info>
      <title>Space Menu</title>
      <short-title>Space Menu</short-title>
      <keywords>social</keywords>
    </portlet-info>
  </portlet>
{code}

h1. MembersPortlet
h2. Description
Display MemberSpace where you can search for space members or list space members in alphabet
h2. Portlet.xml

{code:xml}
 <portlet>
    <description xml:lang="EN">Members Portlet</description>
    <portlet-name>MembersPortlet</portlet-name>
    <display-name xml:lang="EN">Members</display-name>
    <portlet-class>org.exoplatform.webui.application.portlet.PortletApplicationController</portlet-class>
    <init-param>
      <name>webui.configuration</name>
      <value>/WEB-INF/conf/portlet/MembersPortlet/webui/configuration.xml</value>
    </init-param>
    <expiration-cache>0</expiration-cache>
    <supports>
      <mime-type>text/html</mime-type>
    </supports>
    <supported-locale>en</supported-locale>
    <resource-bundle>locale.portlet.MembersPortlet</resource-bundle>

      <keywords>social</keywords>
    </portlet-info>
  </portlet>
{code}

h1. SpaceSettingPortlet
h2. Description
Shows the settings of Space: Settings, Visibility, Members, Application. You can change the setting information of a space if you are the creator of that space or have the manager right on it.
h2. Portlet.xml

{code:xml}
 <portlet>
    <description xml:lang="EN">Space Setting Portlet</description>
    <portlet-name>SpaceSettingPortlet</portlet-name>
    <display-name xml:lang="EN">Space Setting</display-name>
    <portlet-class>org.exoplatform.webui.application.portlet.PortletApplicationController</portlet-class>
    <init-param>
      <name>webui.configuration</name>
      <value>/WEB-INF/conf/portlet/SpaceSettingPortlet/webui/configuration.xml</value>
    </init-param>
    <expiration-cache>0</expiration-cache>
    <supports>
      <mime-type>text/html</mime-type>
      <portlet-mode>help</portlet-mode>
    </supports>
    <supported-locale>en</supported-locale>
    <resource-bundle>locale.portlet.SpaceSettingPortlet</resource-bundle>
    <portlet-info>
      <title>Space Setting</title>
      <short-title>Space Setting</short-title>
      <keywords>social</keywords>
    </portlet-info>
  </portlet>
{code}
